## DESCRIPTION

This package simply aims to reproduce an error encountered while working
on a bigger [project](https://github.com/informalr/informalr/)
when using pipes (%>%).

In short,
GHA [fails](https://github.com/informalr/informalr/actions/runs/442815899)
to build on macOS and Ubuntu when pipes are used on a single line.

## MOCK R FILE

This package contains one R scripts (function1.R).

function1 cleans the dataframe given as input

```{r}
df1 <- data.frame(col1 = c(1,NA,2), col2 = c(3,NA,4))
print(df1)
function1(df1)
```

## ERROR

Two branches (good_pipe and bad_pipe) show the correct and incorrect usage of
pipes according to lintr.

However the error message is misleading. Why?
